name: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
references: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest and Clifford Stein, Introduction to Algorithms, Third Edition, PHI, 2009.
Michael T. Goodrich and Roberto Tamassia, Algorithm Design: Foundations, Analysis and Internet Examples, Second Edition, Wiley-India, 2006.
Ellis Horowitz, Sartaj Sahni and Sanguthevar Rajasekaran, Fundamentals of Computer Algorithms, Second Edition, Universities Press, 2011.
Gilles Brassard and Paul Bratley, Fundamentals of Algorithmics, First Edition, PHI,
S. Dasgupta, C. H. Papadimitriou, and U. V. Vazirani, Algorithms, First Edition, McGraw Hill Education, 2006.
Sara Baase, Computer algorithms: Introduction to Design and Analysis, Second Edition, Addison Wesley publication, 1998.

Divide and Conquer Algorithms: Merge Sort, Quick Sort and Randomized Quicksort with their analyses
Greedy Algorithms: Design scenarios calling for a greedy design
Prim’s and Kruskal’s algorithms for Minimum Spanning Tree construction
Dijkstra’s algorithm for finding single source shortest paths
Dynamic Programming: Design scenarios calling for a dynamic programming design
Backtracking: Enumeration of Independent Sets of a problem
Robotic path finding problem in an unknown terrain
